blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Grourem Groudon and Kyurem fusion Ice/Ground Type Ability: Sheer Force/Pure Power Stats: HP - 115, Atk - 160, Def - 120, SpA -...
caption:
Grourem

Groudon and Kyurem fusion

Ice/Ground Type

Ability: Sheer Force/Pure Power

Stats: HP - 115, Atk - 160, Def - 120, SpA - 140, SpD - 110, Spe - 105

The Mighty Titan Pokemon

Grourem represents both sandy and icy desserts and uses it desert powers to threaten anyone who gets in its way.  This massive beast will let small pokemon ride on its back if it sees them struggling. If you feel a rumbling, run. 

Request for @yvetaltokisaki. I hope you like it! A big boy. Any fusion is possible if you believe!

blog.name: spectraspecs-writes
blog.title: Specs Writes Stuff
blog.description:
Writing Masterpost ;;;; Tag List

Call me Specs! Will post original writing and stuff about characters, so if you don't want to see/don't care, blacklist the tag "specs writes stuff", I'll try to tag it all with that, but sometimes I forget./Posts about my dog are tagged “my little zoey”, she is a mini dachshund and my baby./ Autistic girl and sci-fi writer - obsessed with biology and loaded with problems, but aren't we all. Hufflepuff/INTP/ace biromantic wlw/use whatever pronouns you like i don't give a shit. Heading by @procrastinatorprocrastinates, all the David Tennant pics added by me

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Kyurem
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Kyurem
body:
646: Kyurem

And last we have Kyurem. The third Legendary dragon, and the incomplete, broken husk of what both Reshiram and Zekrom once were. And this skulking Dragon/Ice type is a neat one. In being a broken and tattered Dragon, it’s all bent over with a hunch, one wing and side of its skull messed up, and an extremely muted color palette. Supposedly, back many years ago, when the two heroes of Unova had their kerfuffle, their hero Dragon had also split apart, Reshiram and Zekrom each going with one of the heroes. All that remained of the original Dragon was Kyurem. Now a sad little mess waiting for a new hero to come along and make it whole again.

The connecting of elements between Reshiram and Zekrom also extend out to Kyurem here. Kyurem is notably more beastial in shape and stance, as opposed to Reshiram and Zekrom both being bipedal Dragons. Kyurem is also mostly missing a tail, against the other  two where their tails are one of the centerpieces of their designs. And where as Reshiram and Zekrom are the Yin and Yang, Kyurem is a representative of Wuji, the absence of either Yin or Yang. Which also goes along with their elemental theming as well. The team that’s going after Reshiram or Zekrom, depending on your game, is called Team Plasma. The secondary typings of the Dragons are Fire and Electric respectively; both as forms of plasma or energy. Kyurem, being an Ice type, and being the Gray contrarian to both Reshi and Zek, is the complete absence of energy.

A crazy amount of thought went into the three, at least with all of the under the hood theming. In which this kind of marks a new direction Gamefreak slowly took with the cover Legendaries being more fleshed out rather than just some weird horse-dragon that embodies time I guess. I’ve already complained that it would’ve been cool if the three got to be other creatures and not just dragons, but I digress. The three of them are cool as a trio enough to where I’ll let it slide.

Personal Score: 9/10

Kyurem is quite the cool one.

Black Kyurem:

But as most Pokemon fans know, there was also a twist in the obligatory “third version” for Gen 5. Instead of just a Pokemon Gray, we got… sequels! Yeah, actual sequels! Black 2 and White 2, both continuing on the story of their respective version. And at the end of the game, you confront one of two new forms of Kyurem, each one horribly and forcefully meshed together with one of the other dragons.  Bad sadly, I don’t think either of them look quite as good as unfused Kyurem does. But they’re still cool enough.

Black Kyurem, obviously fused with Zekrom, does plenty get to show that Kyurem’s slightly more complete, but still looking like a mess. But I wish they played up that angle a little more. Kyurem was all about being disfigured and asymmetric. Sadly, both of these forms are super symmetrical. Which you wouldn’t think is the case given this thing is still only two-thirds of one dragon. Yeah, maybe it should technically look more complete, but I still think the thing should just look horrible. Especially given how one party of this fusion wants nothing to do with it. I do appreciate that a slightly more complete form of Kyurem still looks like a wreck.

Personal Score: 8/10

Mood.

White Kyurem:

Despite my leaning toward Zekrom, I think White Kyurem looks slightly better than Black Kyurem does. Its frozen half just looks a tad bit more messed up, so I can take victory there at least. Its face is also closer to the old Kyurem’s, which looked cooler anyways. I do like the visual that one half of the dragon looks more complete, but then the other half has to be made up of ice to look more complete. And between the two forms, it’s the opposite half that’s frozen. More or less signifying that Kyurem’s still needs that other half to become whole.

Personal Score: 8.5/10

Pretty nice! But still not topping the OG.

…And surprisingly enough, we never get to see what Kyurem looks like completed. Which really makes Kyurem seem like an odd one out in this Third-Version-Legendary mantra they’ve been doing since Platinum. We get to see Giratina’s original form, a completed Zygarde, and an uncorrupted Necrozma. And while we get to see Kyurem horribly mish-mashed with its dragon pals, we at no point get to see what the three look like fully fused. Or even the three-way fusion going horribly wrong because two out of the three dragons not consenting for this fusion. Which seems oddly uncharacteristic, given how they’ve otherwise jumped on the opportunity to sell more forms of Legendaries.

Overall:

A really cool set of monsters. I like the way these three dragons tie together so neatly, and I probably wouldn’t like them so much if it wasn’t for their synnergy.

[Archive]

[[MORE]]

Kyurem is notably more beastial in shape and stance, as opposed to Reshiram and Zekrom both being bipedal Dragons. Kyurem is also mostly missing a tail, against the other  two where their tails are one of the centerpieces of their designs. And where as Reshiram and Zekrom are the Yin and Yang, Kyurem is a representative of Wuji, the absence of either Yin or Yang. Which also goes along with their elemental theming as well. The team that’s going after Reshiram or Zekrom, depending on your game, is called Team Plasma. The secondary typings of the Dragons are Fire and Electric respectively; both as forms of plasma or energy. Kyurem, being an Ice type, and being the Gray contrarian to both Reshi and Zek, is the complete absence of energy.

A crazy amount of thought went into the three, at least with all of the under the hood theming. In which this kind of marks a new direction Gamefreak slowly took with the cover Legendaries being more fleshed out rather than just some weird horse-dragon that embodies time I guess. I’ve already complained that it would’ve been cool if the three got to be other creatures and not just dragons, but I digress. The three of them are cool as a trio enough to where I’ll let it slide.

Personal Score: 9/10

Kyurem is quite the cool one.

Black Kyurem:

But as most Pokemon fans know, there was also a twist in the obligatory “third version” for Gen 5. Instead of just a Pokemon Gray, we got… sequels! Yeah, actual sequels! Black 2 and White 2, both continuing on the story of their respective version. And at the end of the game, you confront one of two new forms of Kyurem, each one horribly and forcefully meshed together with one of the other dragons.  Bad sadly, I don’t think either of them look quite as good as unfused Kyurem does. But they’re still cool enough.

Black Kyurem, obviously fused with Zekrom, does plenty get to show that Kyurem’s slightly more complete, but still looking like a mess. But I wish they played up that angle a little more. Kyurem was all about being disfigured and asymmetric. Sadly, both of these forms are super symmetrical. Which you wouldn’t think is the case given this thing is still only two-thirds of one dragon. Yeah, maybe it should technically look more complete, but I still think the thing should just look horrible. Especially given how one party of this fusion wants nothing to do with it. I do appreciate that a slightly more complete form of Kyurem still looks like a wreck.

Personal Score: 8/10

Mood.

White Kyurem:

Despite my leaning toward Zekrom, I think White Kyurem looks slightly better than Black Kyurem does. Its frozen half just looks a tad bit more messed up, so I can take victory there at least. Its face is also closer to the old Kyurem’s, which looked cooler anyways. I do like the visual that one half of the dragon looks more complete, but then the other half has to be made up of ice to look more complete. And between the two forms, it’s the opposite half that’s frozen. More or less signifying that Kyurem’s still needs that other half to become whole.

Personal Score: 8.5/10

Pretty nice! But still not topping the OG.

…And surprisingly enough, we never get to see what Kyurem looks like completed. Which really makes Kyurem seem like an odd one out in this Third-Version-Legendary mantra they’ve been doing since Platinum. We get to see Giratina’s original form, a completed Zygarde, and an uncorrupted Necrozma. And while we get to see Kyurem horribly mish-mashed with its dragon pals, we at no point get to see what the three look like fully fused. Or even the three-way fusion going horribly wrong because two out of the three dragons not consenting for this fusion. Which seems oddly uncharacteristic, given how they’ve otherwise jumped on the opportunity to sell more forms of Legendaries.

Overall:

A really cool set of monsters. I like the way these three dragons tie together so neatly, and I probably wouldn’t like them so much if it wasn’t for their synnergy.

[Archive]

summary: Home.  Rules.  Message.  Masterlist.  Credit. Looking for a place where you can write your muses to your...
caption:
Home.  Rules.  Message.  Masterlist.  Credit.

Looking for a place where you can write your muses to your hearts’ content? Ever wonder if your OC will find a place to fit in? Then look no further!

                                  Welcome to the National Park !

We are a game-verse Pokémon RP group full of fun, friendly, and active members.  Our goal is to provide a comfortable atmosphere where members can write and develop their muses at their own pace, without all the stress of running an indie blog.

In addition to our community of wonderful writers, we offer frequent events, interactive Discord server, unlimited meme opportunities, and a special ‘Member of the Month’ spotlight!

We love welcoming new friends, so why not check us out today?
